article.headline: McNeese St. 74, Texas-San Antonio 53
article.story: SAN ANTONIO (AP) -- Jarvis Bradley's 15 points and 14 rebounds led McNeese State to a 74-53 win Wednesday night over Texas-San Antonio. Bradley made 9-of-10 free throws and McNeese State shot 82 percent overall from the line, compared to 69 percent free-throw shooting by UTSA. Also scoring in double figures for McNeese State (12-13, 6-7 Southland) were John Ford with 14 points, Kleon Penn with 12 and Diego Kapelan with 10 points. Penn and John Pichon added eight rebounds apiece for McNeese State, which held a 47-25 rebounding edge over the Roadrunners (12-14, 6-7). McNeese State led by one at the half, but outscored UTSA 40-20 in the second half. Texas-San Antonio had won four straight. Isaiah Allen led the Roadrunners with 14 points, while JohnMark Ludwick scored 12 and Devin Gibson added 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
